alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 6:29PM EDT until August 08 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern Delaware...southern New Jersey...and southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in northern Delaware...New Castle. In southern New Jersey...Camden, Gloucester, and Salem. In southeast Pennsylvania...Chester, Delaware, Montgomery, and Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 629 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Rainfall amounts of 1.0 to 1.5 inches are possible in a short amount of time. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia, Camden, Wilmington, Gloucester City, Cherry Hill, Norristown, Chester, Deptford, Voorhees, West Deptford, Glassboro, and Lindenwold. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 1 and 3. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 319 and 338. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 29. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 15 and 23. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 327 and 351. Interstate 76 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 35. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
